seo.description: Answers to frequently asked questions about visiting Cinque Terre. Cinque Terre Card, hiking trails, best villages, transport, and essential travel tips.

body.title: Frequently Asked Questions
body.subtitle: Everything you need to know about visiting Cinque Terre, from Cinque Terre Cards to hiking trails and accommodation

features.title: Do I need a Cinque Terre Card?
features.description: Recommended for hiking trails and unlimited train travel. Not needed for just visiting villages by train

features.title: How many days should I spend?
features.description: Minimum 2-3 days to see all villages. 4-5 days ideal for hiking, relaxing, and experiencing local life

features.title: Which village is best to stay in?
features.description: Monterosso for beaches, Vernazza for charm, Manarola for views, Riomaggiore for nightlife, Corniglia for quiet

features.title: How do I travel between villages?
features.description: Train (fastest), ferry (scenic, seasonal), hiking trails (most rewarding), or combination of all three

features.title: Are hiking trails difficult?
features.description: Vary from easy (Via dell'Amore) to strenuous (high paths). Proper shoes essential. Some sections can be closed

features.title: Can I bring large luggage?
features.description: Not recommended. Villages have steep stairs and narrow streets. Use luggage storage in La Spezia if needed
